description:
These Red Wine Braised Instant Pot Short Ribs are the perfect choice to impress your guests and convert them to Instant Pot-ism. ðŸ˜‰

No need to turn on your oven or slow cook the short ribs for hours to achieve this rich beefy melt-in-your-mouth heaven-on-earth.

Plus, you can save time by cooking potatoes at the same time right in the same pot. How awesome is that?!
directions:
Brown Short Ribs in Instant Pot: Heat up Instant Pot using SautÃ© More. Wait until it says HOT (prevents short ribs from sticking to the pot). Add 1 tbsp (15ml) olive oil in Instant Pot. Season one side generously with salt and black pepper. Add in 5 pieces of short ribs, then brown each side for 4 minutes. While one side is browning, season the other side with more salt and black pepper.

*Pro Tip: Avoid overcrowding by browning short ribs in batches.

SautÃ© Onion & Garlic: Set aside the browned short ribs. Add in sliced onions, and sautÃ© until soften (~ 3 minutes). Add in chopped garlic, and sautÃ© until fragrant (~30 seconds).

SautÃ© Veggies & Spices: Add in chopped carrots, celery, a pinch of dried thyme, and 2 bay leaves, then sautÃ© for 2 minutes.

Deglaze Instant Pot: Pour Â½ cup (125ml) red wine in Instant Pot and deglaze by scrubbing the flavorful brown bits off the bottom of the pot with a wooden spoon. Give it a quick mix. Let the wine simmer for a minute to allow some of the alcohol to evaporate.

Pressure Cook Short Ribs: Add 1 tbsp (15ml) regular soy sauce, 1 tbsp (15ml) fish sauce, 1-1.5 tbsp (14-21g) brown sugar, 2 tbsp (30ml) balsamic vinegar, and Â½ cup (125ml) unsalted chicken stock in Instant Pot. Carefully add in browned short ribs + meat juice.

If you are making mashed potatoes: Cut 3 - 4 potatoes in half, then place them in a stainless steel bowl. Layer the bowl on top of the short ribs.

Then, pressure cook:

With Potatoes: High Pressure 42 minutes + Natural Release 15 minutes

No Potatoes: High Pressure 45 minutes + Natural Release 15 minutes

Optional - Make Mashed Potatoes: Drain & transfer the potatoes to a larger mixing bowl. Mash the potatoes with a potato masher. Mix in 100ml whole milk and 1 â€“ 2 tbsp (14g -28g) unsalted butter. Season to taste with salt & pepper.

Thicken & Seasonings: Carefully set aside the short ribs. Mix 2.5 tbsp (22.5g) cornstarch and 3 tbsp (45ml) cold water together in a small mixing bowl. Bring the sauce to a simmer and add the cornstarch mixture one third at a time to thicken the red wine sauce until desired thickness. Taste and season with more salt, black pepper, and brown sugar if necessary (For reference: we added 3 large pinches of salt).

Serve Short Ribs: Carefully place the short ribs back in the sauce to keep them hot. Serve & be prepared for your guests to beg for more of this deliciously beautiful creation!

Season one side generously with salt and black pepper. Add in 5 pieces of short ribs, then brown each side for 4 minutes. While one side is browning, season the other side with more salt and black pepper.

*Pro Tip: Avoid overcrowding by browning short ribs in batches.

SautÃ© Veggies & Spices: Add in chopped carrots, celery, a pinch of dried thyme, and 2 bay leaves, then sautÃ© for 2 minutes.

No Potatoes: High Pressure 45 minutes + Natural Release 15 minutes

Thicken & Seasonings: Carefully set aside the short ribs. Mix 2.5 tbsp (22.5g) cornstarch and 3 tbsp (45ml) cold water together in a small mixing bowl. Taste and season with more salt, black pepper, and brown sugar if necessary (For reference: we added 3 large pinches of salt).

Serve Short Ribs: Carefully place the short ribs back in the sauce to keep them hot. Serve & be prepared for your guests to beg for more of this deliciously beautiful creation!
html.ingredients:
6 - 10 pieces (1116g) bone-in short ribs (1.5 - 2 inches thick)

6 cloves garlic , crushed and chopped

2 (300g) small onions , sliced

2 (170g) medium carrots , chopped

2 ribs (90g) celery , chopped

Â½ cup (125ml) red wine (Cabernet Sauvignon)

Â½ cup (125ml) unsalted chicken stock or good quality beef broth

2 tablespoons (30ml) balsamic vinegar

1 - 1.5 tablespoon (14-21g) brown sugar

1 tablespoon (15ml) regular soy sauce

1 tablespoon (15ml) fish sauce

1 tablespoon (15ml) olive oil

2 bay leaves

A pinch dried thyme

Kosher salt and ground black pepper to taste

Thickener:

2.5 tablespoons (22.5g) cornstarch

3 tablespoons (45ml) cold water

Mashed Potatoes (Optional):

3 - 4 russet potatoes , halved

100 ml whole milk

1 - 2 tablespoons (14g - 28g) unsalted butter
